definition: to reinforce/to increase troop numbers/reinforcements/extra troops

sentences.english: Yes, by sending more troops, he did more-or-less the right thing eventually.
sentences.chinese: 是的，阿富汗增兵，或許他最終還是做了正確的決定。

sentences.english: When the surge ends, the United States will have 140, 000 troops in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 到增兵結束時，美國在伊拉克的駐兵數量將是14萬。

sentences.english: He reinforced the troops in Afghanistan, but set a date to start withdrawing, a careful bit of bet-hedging.
sentences.chinese: 他決定增兵阿富汗但卻小心的設置了保底的撤退時間。

sentences.english: Influx of 20,000 U.S. troops to Iraq aimed at, among other things, quelling sectarian violence.
sentences.chinese: 布什總統爲了平息伊拉克的暴亂增兵兩萬。

sentences.english: We will maintain this increased force level for the next 18 months.
sentences.chinese: 我們將在未來18個月內保持增兵後的軍力水平。

sentences.english: The report wasreleased just before President Bush’s surge in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 這份報告公佈的時機恰值總統布什增兵伊拉克之前。

sentences.english: I think if they want to send more troops that's fine.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲如果他們想多增兵那也行。

sentences.english: Before the surge, there were about 132, 000 U.S. troops in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 增兵前，駐伊美軍有13萬2千人。

sentences.english: President Obama ordered an increase in troops fighting the nearly ten-year-old war.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬下令增兵阿富汗這場近十年的戰爭。

definition: to dispatch an army/to send troops
